ygData.subject: Re: Hunting minotaurs for horns
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Ah nope - not hanging for a minotaur horn. Actually like many people, was hanging out in Beholder to get a minotaur axe or three - and well, minotaur horns
ygData.messageBody:
>From: Rodney Morris <rodmorris@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqbards] Hunting minotaurs for horns
>Date: Fri, 21 May 1999 23:04:14 +1000
>
>From: Rodney Morris <rodmorris@...>
>
>
>jay schultze wrote:
>
> > Depends on where you currently are hanging out. I was mostly in Beholder
> > around that level with a group. Hunting minos for their axes and a horn
>(for
> > later use).
>
>Just an aside, but if you are hanging for a minotaur horn, don't
>bust a gut to hunt minotaurs to get one. I bought mine from a
>store in Freeport for around the 5g mark. Much easier, and less
>fun, too. But if you have other things to do, I'd recommend my
>method.
>
>
>Rocket
>

Ah nope - not hanging for a minotaur horn. Actually like many people, was
hanging out in Beholder to get a minotaur axe or three - and well, minotaur
horns just kinda happen. Usually left there with a few at least. Just saying
it's an easy way to get a wind instrument while you are going for the xp and
the axes.

Sartori of Kelethin
